page.title: 16Energy
page.content: In the area close to Werrington there is a large power station owned by the Central Electricity Generating Board. It takes power at 400,000 volts and 130,000 volts and breaks it down before providing the Midlands Electricity Board with a more managable level of power so they are able to provide the consumer with their 240 volts. The station has 2 feeders one to the North which goes as far as Yorkshire and one to the South which stretchs down to the Trent Valley.The power goes out on a pylon line which because of its position is prone to regular disruption from lightening. Suprisingly power is provided for the station by the M.E.B. and incase of a power failure the station has three diesel generators as a backup.
